section.name: FAQ
section.p:
Frequent questions:
Is it possible to create a web application using genesis?
How does genesis compare with Spring?
When will genesis support swing api?
How can I use genesis within J2ME applications?
Why am I getting a NullPointerException in a getSession() call??
Where is technical support?

subsection.name: Is it possible to create a web application using genesis?
subsection.p: genesis current version can already be used with any web framework, such as Struts or WebWork.

In order to create a web application, it's just necessary to create a project that uses genesis business components. Besides that, genesis will have its own web framework, but right now, it is not true.

subsection.name: How does genesis compare with Spring?
subsection.p: These two projects have different goals. While genesis focus in resolving the problem of providing an easier way to develop graphical interface and business code, Spring framework focus in getting J2EE development easier and in promoting the use of certains practices, like reducing the cost of programming to interfaces programming. Although both frameworks support Hibernate, Spring has a more generic dependency injection and genesis has also a generic one but not so complete as the Spring one. However, some genesis functionalities are not provided by Spring, such as Working with dynamic searches.
Generic support to dynamic searches should be added to genesis release 0.3

subsection.name: When will genesis support swing api?
subsection.p: Swing will be supported in nexts genesis releases. There is no certain date for this to happen, but mostly it will be done till mid year.

subsection.name: How can I use genesis within J2ME applications?
subsection.p: It is recommended to only use a sub-set of the functionalities provided in the package UI, like the direct use of net.java.dev.genesis.ui.thinlet.BaseThinlet for example. Advanced functionalities like binding will mostly not work within those environments.
To support all major genesis functionalities within J2ME is part of the genesis development team, but there is no certain date for this to happen.

subsection.name: Why am I getting a NullPointerException in a getSession() call?
subsection.p:
There are several situations where this problem might occur. Basicaly they are:
The class that depends on the injection of the Session is in the wrong place within the source code hierarchy (in the client module, for example). This way, the weaving process will not affect that class as intended and the Hibernate session will not be injected.
There has been a method call chain using business objects. In this case, a Hibernate Session is not injected in secondary calls. To fix this code, one just needs to use the setSession(Session) method of the callee object using the caller Session as parameter.
In the case it is first time one is trying to build a new project, build process may not be working properly.
